tha-ap443:0.3_0: Like a monkey in the alms-food of Assaji and Punabbasuka,
tha-ap443:1.2_0: who has gone beyond all things.
tha-ap443:1.4_0: and went to a forest grove.
tha-ap443:2.3_0: At a time when the Buddha tread,
tha-ap443:2.4_0: who practice absorption in this way.
tha-ap443:3.4_0: and the seeds of the seeds.
tha-ap443:4.1_0: But in this life it may be used
tha-ap443:4.3_0: I’m not aware of any bad places
tha-ap443:4.4_0: And I carry fruit the fruits of that.
tha-ap443:5.1_0: My defilements have been burnt away by practicing absorption—
tha-ap443:5.2_0: rebirth into all states of existence is eradicated,
tha-ap443:7.1_0: Attaining the four kinds of textual analysis
tha-ap443:7.2_0: and skeleton without flesh or blood,
tha-ap443:7.3_0: I have realized the six kinds of direct knowledge,
tha-ap443:8.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Bhalliya.
tha-ap443:9.1_0: Bhallika, in the first part of the senior monks.
